Because internal variability in a LE is uncorrelated across realizations, averaging over ensemble members damps noise and improves estimates of externally forced signals ( Fig. 1). LEs are a valuable test bed for analyzing the signal-to-noise (S/N) characteristics of different regions, seasons, and climate variables ( 1
– 5) and for comparing simulated and observed internal variability ( 6). Such information can inform “fingerprint” studies ( 7), which seek to identify externally forced climate change patterns in observations ( 8, 9).
